PageTitle: oam-bind ingress cfm md ma egress cfm md ma
FuncDef:
The oam-bind ingress cfm md ma egress cfm md ma command configures Ethernet CFM on one side to send fault messages to Ethernet CFM on the other side.
The undo oam-bind ingress cfm md ma egress cfm md ma command disables Ethernet CFM on one side from sending fault messages to Ethernet CFM on the other side.
By default, Ethernet CFM on one side is disabled from sending fault messages to Ethernet CFM on the other side.
CLIs: oam-bind ingress cfm md <md-name1> ma <ma-name1> egress cfm md <md-name2> ma <ma-name2>
undo oam-bind ingress cfm md <md-name1> ma <ma-name1> egress cfm md <md-name2> ma <ma-name2>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an MD.
The value is a string of 1 to 43 case-sensitive characters. Question marks (?) are not supported.

Specifies the name of an MA.
The value is a string of 1 to 43 case-sensitive characters. Question marks (?), hyphens (-) are not supported. The total length of MA and MD names must be no greater than 44 characters.

Specifies the name of another MD.
The value is a string of 1 to 43 case-sensitive characters. Question marks (?) are not supported.

Specifies the name of another MA.
The value is a string of 1 to 43 case-sensitive characters. Question marks (?), hyphens (-) are not supported. The total length of MA and MD names must be no greater than 44 characters.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-oam-mgr] oam-bind ingress cfm md mdcustomer ma macustomer1 egress cfm md mdcustomer ma macustomer2
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If CFM is configured on two sides of a device, the oam-bind cfm md ma cfm md ma command can be used to associate the CFM modules with each other to enable bidirectional transmission of fault messages between the CFM modules.
Prerequisites
CFM has been configured.
